byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Milwaukee, and Mitch Smith from Chicago. Matt Apuzzo contributed reporting from Washington, and J. David Goodman from New York.
byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

abstract: Murder rates are rising sharply in cities across United States after years of decline, with Milwaukee seeing worst increase; city has recorded 104 murders as of August, compared to 86 in all of 2014; officials have offered differing explanations for spike, though many point to increased violence in common disputes among young men in poor neighborhoods across nation.
lead_paragraph: Cities across the nation are seeing a startling rise in murders this year, and few places have witnessed a shift as precipitous as Milwaukee.

headline.main: Murder Rates Rising Sharply in Many U.S. Cities
headline.print_headline: Murder Rates Rising Sharply in Many Cities

snippet: Cities across the nation are seeing a startling rise in murders this year, and few places have witnessed a shift as precipitous as Milwaukee.
